CatDescriptText: Mr. Glen Mori Sue, art student, Sharon and Miss Emily Latek, unemployed, Beaver Falls, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, March 3, 1962, pg. 10 with question: "In what way do you think the successful orbiting of Col. John Glenn will aid the United States in its relationship with other countries?"  Mr. Sue's answer reads: "It will help us in dealing with Russia, particularly."  Ms. Latek's answer reads: "I believe it will help in bringing about peace, especially seeing how Khrushchev already has sent a letter to President Kennedy, asking that we get together on a space program."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Glen Mori Sue wearing plaid shirt and leather jacket with knitted collar and sleeves, standing in front of ribbed metal wall; Portrait of Emily Latek wearing double breasted herringbone coat, holding purse with chain strap, standing in front of building, Downtown
